commitResults.messageTitle: Duke.java: Added greeting, goodbye messages, chat bot user input app loop.

Duke.java: Moved chat bot logic out of application file. ChatBot.java: Logic of chat bot previously from Duke.java moved here, with minor adjustments to method/variable names to better reflect what they are.

ChatBot.java: Minor modification to echo function format, along with renaming of certain variables to reflect changes in functionality. Added list functionality as required in level-2. ChatList.java: Created new List class customised to encapsulate the required list logic.

Replaced ChatList.java with Task.java and TaskList.java, which better describes a list of tasks. Removed the ability to change the name of the ChatBot due to redundancy. Methodised all cases in handle methods in ChatBot.java.

Made Task class abstract and created Deadline.java, Event.java and ToDo.java which inherits from the Task class, to support different types of tasks. Changes to ChatBot.java logic to support the new types of tasks. Removed support for the general Task.
Abstractions made to handle the creation of tasks in a single separate method. Shortened the start method through removing redundant code. Added a method to handle unexpected user inputs.
Included text based io redirection automated testing to test for regression in future versions of Chattus.

Restructured project by packaging related classes together. Moved parsing functionality of ChatBot to LineParser to reduce bloat in ChatBot. Included Case enum to allow for easier labelling and handling of cases. Created InvalidCaseException and InvalidInputException to aid in handling exceptions.
Included delete task functionality and modified test case to check for regression from this stage.
Update all existing code to comply with Java coding standard
commitResults.messageBody:
Current state of code does not comply entirely with Java coding
standard.

Existing code needs to be modified to meet standards.

Existing code has been modified to meet standards.

Current state of code has many unnecessary usage of 'this' keyword.

Removing these unnecessary usage of 'this' keyword reduces
unnecessary noise in the code.

Remove unnecessary use of 'this' keyword.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update import statements to follow Java conventions
commitResults.messageBody:
There were 2 import statement that was out of lexicographical order.

Update import statements to follow lexicographical order.

Restructuring of the project through packaging of relevant files
has resulted in the path in the runtest.sh file to be inconsistent
with the changes made.

Modify the path in the runtest.sh file to be consistent with
changes made.

commitResults.messageTitle: Format switch case segments to follow course's Java conventions
commitResults.messageBody:
Switch case statement does not follow course's Java conventions.

Format switch case segments to satisfy above subject.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement file save and load functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Application currently does not have any functionality to save or
load files.

Adding save and load functionality will allow for users to retain
any tasks that they input.

Lets.
1. Implement taskfilemanager package with classes which serve to
enable file save and load functionality.
2. Rename LineParser.java to CommandParser.java to avoid confusion
between TaskLineParser.java and LineParser.java.
3. Modify existing code to support file save and load functionality.
4. Add new exception TaskFileException.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update ChatBot.java to adhere to project's Java conventions
commitResults.messageBody:
ChatBot.java was modified in a previous commit, which resulted in
non-adherence to the project's Java conventions.

Swap positions of fields in ChatBot.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement rigid date and time functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Event.java and Deadline.java currently uses strings to store
date and time, which is of little use.

Making use of proper date and time abstractions would enhance the
usefulness of the product.

Lets,
1. Use java.time.LocalDateTime instead of String representation of
date and deadline representations in Event.java and Deadline.java.
2. Modify LineParser.java to support the change in representations.
3. Implement check command which displays all tasks that are on the
specified date.

In a recent commit, the gitignore was modified to include
/data/duke.txt in order to stop tracking files generated by the
application.

Change gitignore to include /data instead of /data/duke.txt.
